result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcia M. Gilbert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered restitution in the amount of $12,506.91 owed to the estate of Margarlene R. and payable as a condition of probation. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered. ($500.00 has already been paid).
**1/4/2015  Honorable William S. Pocan-Order signed.   Balance due for restitution in sum of $8,073.57 as reported in  the estate's final account  shall be distributed as follows:  each payment paid to following beneficiaries, one third (1/3) to each of them:  Linda S.; Nikolas L.; estate of Walter L,  c/o Thomas L.  Said payments to beneficiareis shall continue until each receives the sum of $1,654.64.  
Following completion of full payments to above, defendant shall be credited the sum of $3,109.65 towards restitution amount previously ordered and thereafter no further payments will be required of her.
Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within term of probation or, if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Pay restitution as ordered.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

records.addlTxt: Amended
Per Order signed on 1/4/2015.
Cover letter and Estate Account documentation filed on 12-23-15.

Order Modifying Restitution, signed and filed.  

*see actual order for specifics*

Defendant Marcia M. Gilbert not in court, defendant in custody. 
Attorney James Collis, Personal Representative for the Estate of Margarlene R.
Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court on Motion to Modify Restitution Order.  Attorney Colis attempting to close out the estate of Margarlene R. and requests outstanding restitution distributed to the heirs.  The Department of Corrections requires the Court to order change in payee.  Motion to change restitution payee heard and granted.  The Court orders outstanding restitution payable to beneficiaries of the estate of Margarlene R. listed as follows:  Marcia G., Linda S., Nikolas L., Estate of Walter L. c/o Thomas Lehrke.  Attorney Collis to submit order reflecting actual percentage as to each heir and details regarding payout to Marcia G. (defendant) under the 5-day rule.  File, copy of UNSIGNED proposed order.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Telephone call to attorney James Collis' office regarding upcoming motion hearing.  Defense counsel unable to make December 15, 2015 at 1:30.  Case rescheduled to December 17, 2015 at 1:30 as requested.
Restitution hearing at 12-15-2015 01:30 pm
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. mag
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO MODIFY RESTITUTION ORDER
Order for extending Probation for unpaid court obligations filed and signed by the Court.  Probation is extended for 1 year from 9/8/15 to 9/8/16.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Pocan
for review. os

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcia M. Gilbert in court with attorney Peter A. Stanford.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.        Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $12,506.91 owed to the estate of Margarlene R. and payable as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  ($500.00 has already been paid).  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0
days time served, Huber privileges for work.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1
year with the following conditions:
*
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Pay restitution as ordered above.
*Perform 25 hours of community service.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within term of probation or, if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Entry made without file.
State does not object to Atty Stanford's request for adjournment.  8/8 rescheduled to SEPTEMBER 8, 2014, 8:30am.  kmw

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:  Defendant waived rights and pled NO CONTEST.  Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a no contest plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the amended information.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge POCAN, Branch 26, in ROOM 634 of the COURTHOUSE.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-08-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcia M. Gilbert in court with attorney Peter A. Stanford.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information filed charging:  THEFT (VALUE LESS THAN $2,500), a Class Misdemeanor.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

All parties are notified that effective August 4, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge POCAN, Branch 26, in ROOM 634 of the COURTHOUSE.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of this notice.  kmw

Defendant Marcia M. Gilbert in court with attorney Peter A Stanford.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.
DE acknowledging 4/22, 8:30 scheduling.  kmw
Per Atty Stanford request, 3/20 rescheduled to APRIL 22, 2014, 8:30am.  kmw

Defendant Marcia M. Gilbert in court with attorney Peter A Stanford.  James Griffin for David Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders warrant withdrawn.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Peter A Stanford in court.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-18-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcia M. Gilbert in court with attorney Peter A Stanford.  Hanna Kolberg for David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (1-10-2014). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Marcia M. Gilbert in court with attorney Peter A Stanford.  No Assistant District Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
